page.title: 07Chaff Barn _ Eartham.
page.content: The Chaff Barn is a small furniture workshop in a converted barn. It was opened in 1982 by Mr. Hankey, and he works here with one other man making quality furniture. The timber which he uses is all local and includes beech, oak,elm and ash which he often buys from the Forestry Commission as trees then fells himself. The timber is then seasoned and kiln dried, with often as much as 50 gallons of moisture being extracted from a 20 cubic foot load! Within the workshop,Mr.Hankey has a circular saw,a power plane and a moulding machine. The furniture which he produces is tables,dressers,cupboards and even toys,usually after receiving special orders rather than piling up stocks. Examples of these are on show in what was once the hay loft of the barn.
